verses.verse: "My soul <S%H5315><s%> is weary <S%H5354><s%> of my life. <S%H2416><s%> I will give free course <S%H5800><s%> to my complaint. <S%H7879><s%> I will speak <S%H1696><s%> in the bitterness <S%H4751><s%> of my soul. <S%H5315><s%>
I will tell <S%H559><s%> God, <S%H433><s%> <S%H7561><s%> 'Do not condemn me. <S%H3045><s%> Show me why you contend with me. <S%H7378><s%>

Is it good <S%H2895><s%> to you that you should oppress, <S%H6231><s%> that you should despise <S%H3988><s%> the work <S%H3018><s%> of your hands, <S%H3709><s%> and smile <S%H3313><s%> on the counsel <S%H6098><s%> of the wicked? <S%H7563><s%>
Do you have eyes <S%H5869><s%> of flesh? <S%H1320><s%> Or do you see <S%H7200><s%> as man <S%H582><s%> sees? <S%H7200><s%>
Are your days <S%H3117><s%> as the days <S%H3117><s%> of mortals, <S%H582><s%> or your years <S%H8141><s%> as man <S%H582><s%>'s years, <S%H8141><s%>
that you inquire <S%H1245><s%> after my iniquity, <S%H5771><s%> and search <S%H1875><s%> after my sin? <S%H2403><s%>
Although you know <S%H1847><s%> that I am not wicked, <S%H7561><s%> there is no one who can deliver <S%H5337><s%> out of your hand. <S%H3027><s%>
<S%H3027><s%>"'Your hands have framed <S%H6087><s%> me and fashioned <S%H6213><s%> me altogether, <S%H3162><s%> <S%H5439><s%> yet you destroy me. <S%H1104><s%>
Remember, <S%H2142><s%> I beg you, <S%H6213><s%> that you have fashioned me as clay. <S%H2563><s%> Will you bring <S%H7725><s%> me into dust <S%H6083><s%> again? <S%H7725><s%>
Haven't <S%H5413><s%> you poured me out like milk, <S%H2461><s%> and curdled <S%H7087><s%> me like cheese? <S%H1385><s%>
You have clothed <S%H3847><s%> me with skin <S%H5785><s%> and flesh, <S%H1320><s%> and knit <S%H7753><s%> me together with bones <S%H6106><s%> and sinews. <S%H1517><s%>
You have granted <S%H6213><s%> me life <S%H2416><s%> and loving kindness. <S%H2617><s%> Your visitation <S%H6486><s%> has preserved <S%H8104><s%> my spirit. <S%H7307><s%>
Yet you hid <S%H6845><s%> these things in your heart. <S%H3824><s%> I know that this is with you: <S%H3045><s%>
if I sin, <S%H2398><s%> then you mark <S%H8104><s%> me. <S%H5352><s%> You will not acquit me from my iniquity. <S%H5771><s%>

If I am wicked, <S%H7561><s%> woe <S%H480><s%> to me. <S%H6663><s%> If I am righteous, I still shall not lift up <S%H5375><s%> my head, <S%H7218><s%> being filled <S%H7649><s%> with disgrace, <S%H7036><s%> and conscious <S%H7202><s%> of my affliction. <S%H6040><s%>
If my head is held high, <S%H1342><s%> you hunt <S%H6679><s%> me like a lion. <S%H7826><s%> Again <S%H7725><s%> you show yourself powerful to me. <S%H6381><s%>

You renew <S%H2318><s%> your witnesses <S%H5707><s%> against me, <S%H7235><s%> and increase your indignation <S%H3708><s%> on me. <S%H5978><s%> Changes <S%H2487><s%> and warfare are with me. <S%H6635><s%>
<S%H3318><s%>"'Why, then, have you brought me forth out of the womb? <S%H7358><s%> I wish I had given up the spirit, <S%H1478><s%> and no eye <S%H5869><s%> had seen me. <S%H7200><s%>
I should have been as though I had not been. <S%H2986><s%> I should have been carried from the womb <S%H990><s%> to the grave. <S%H6913><s%>
Aren't <S%H3117><s%> my days few? <S%H4592><s%> Cease <S%H2308><s%> then. <S%H7896><s%> Leave me alone, that I may find a little <S%H4592><s%> comfort, <S%H1082><s%>
before I go <S%H3212><s%> where I shall not return <S%H7725><s%> from, <S%H776><s%> to the land of darkness <S%H2822><s%> and of the shadow of death; <S%H6757><s%>
the land <S%H776><s%> dark <S%H5890><s%> as midnight, <S%H652><s%> of the shadow of death, <S%H6757><s%> without any order, <S%H5468><s%> where the light <S%H3313><s%> is as midnight. <S%H652><s%>'"
